--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> 
wrote:
> trent o. wrote:
> 
> > Hello,
> > 
> > I'm trying to get JUnit to work happily with Ant within WSAD and 
I'm
> > running into a problem.  I have a simple class and test to try to 
get
> > this going.  When I run my Ant buildfile I get the following 
error:
> > 
> > Testcase: testConstructor took 0 sec
> >       Caused an ERROR
> > junit.framework.Assert: method assertEquals
> > (Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V not 
found
> > java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: junit.framework.Assert: method
> > assertEquals
(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V
> > not found
> >       at
> > 
com.networksByteDesign.eMarket.inventory.salesItemTest.testConstructor
> > (salesItemTest.java:89)
> >       at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run
> > (InternalAntRunner.java:262)
> >       at org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner.run(AntRunner.java:234)
> >       at
> > org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.core.AntFileRunner.execute
> > (AntFileRunner.java:56)
> >       at
> > 
org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.core.DefaultRunnerContext.execut
> > eRunner(DefaultRunnerContext.java:428)
> >       at
> > 
org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.core.DefaultRunnerContext.run
> > (DefaultRunnerContext.java:479)
> >       at
> > org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.ui.AntLaunchWizard$1.run
> > (AntLaunchWizard.java:117)
> >       at
> > org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
> > (ModalContext.java:98)
> > 
> 
> > It seems to be having trouble finding a JUnit core method
> > (assertEquals(String, String, String)) and I'm not sure why.  I 
have
> > the junit.jar in my Classpath.
> 
> Which classpath? WSAD project build path? Ant compile-time class 
path? 
> Ant run-time class path?
> 
> I suspect you are building your application with WSAD, then running 
the 
> tests with Ant. That could be the problem: WSAD 5 ships with JUnit 
3.7 
> and with Ant you are likely using JUnit 3.8.1. Look in the WSAD 
plugins 
> folder for junit.jar and see which version it is. Change your WSAD 
> project to use the same junit.jar as you use with Ant -- preferably 
by 
> creating a WSAD Classpath Variable.
> -- 
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand

J.B., thank you for replying.  How do I modify the WSAD Project 
Path?  I am running this through the XML Perspective, and when you 
left-click on the project and choose properties, the only real 
configuration you can do is add other referenced projects.  Nothing 
about classpath or adding external jars.

I run the Ant script in verbose mode, and I see what you're kind of 
eluding to, that I'm pointing to the wrong version of JUnit.  I see 
the full classpath in the system out, which has no reference to 
JUnit, and then I see the following lines:

<output>
Implicitly adding 
C:\bin\WebSphere\Studio\eclipse\plugins\org.junit_3.7.0
\junit.jar;D:\Ant\apache-ant-1.6.0\lib\ant-launcher.jar;D:\Ant\apache-
ant-1.6.0\lib\ant.jar;D:\Ant\apache-ant-1.6.0\lib\ant-junit.jar to 
CLASSPATH
Using CLASSPATH 
D:\Ant\test;C:\bin\WebSphere\Studio\eclipse\plugins\org.junit_3.7.0
\junit.jar;D:\Ant\apache-ant-1.6.0\lib\ant-launcher.jar;D:\Ant\apache-
ant-1.6.0\lib\ant.jar;D:\Ant\apache-ant-1.6.0\lib\ant-junit.jar
Using CLASSPATH 
D:\Ant\test;C:\bin\WebSphere\Studio\eclipse\plugins\org.junit_3.7.0
\junit.jar;D:\Ant\apache-ant-1.6.0\lib\ant-launcher.jar;D:\Ant\apache-
ant-1.6.0\lib\ant.jar;D:\Ant\apache-ant-1.6.0\lib\ant-junit.jar
</output>

Since that's the first appearance of a JUnit jar, I'm assuming that's 
the one it's using.  I don't know how these jars get implicitly 
added, or how I can change them.  I'm a newbie to Ant/JUnit/WSAD 
combination, can you tell? :)

Thanks,
Trent
